I am working on such IoT project in which I have to connect my ESP8266NodeMCU-Amica to Android App by smartConfig. Now the problem is that, for better security and privacy, Android App should detect only my ESP8266 for smartConfig. Means, Android App should not detect and transmit any data packages(should not give SSID and Password) to any other esp8266 which is not mine. Which protocol or method should I follow? I am coding in ArduinoIDE.

I have already used most popular smartConfig Android App[1] for trial and got succeed[2]. But still can't decide how to detect only my own ESP8266 (no any other esp8266) via Android app for the same smartConfig method.

I have also seen so many links and chats for UDP broadcast packets and successfully tried it for ESP8266 and UDP sender/receiver AndroidApp[3]. But it can be helpful only when ESP and Android will be in the same LOCAL network. And for my case
